rules.prover9_expression: (has_clinical_trial_data(company, drug) | (-(-(has_license(company, production_facility) | has_fda_registration(company, facility)) -> produces(company, approved_drug)) -> has_patent_protection(company, drug)))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that lacking both a production facility license and FDA registration leads to the company producing an approved drug, then the company must have clinical trial data for the drug, or it must possess patent protection for the drug.
If the company conducts safety testing on the drug, then it produces an approved drug.
Either the company's employees have manufacturing skills, or if regulatory review is needed for the drug, then safety testing occurs.

If the company meets GMP standards in its process, then either it has automated systems in the production line or, given that employees have manufacturing skills, it maintains a sterile environment in the facility.
Whenever the company employs certified staff as operators, it meets GMP standards in its process.
Either the company holds an export license for international trade or it has certified staff as operators.
If the company produces an approved drug, then it implements quality control for its process.
Provided that the company adheres to manufacturing guidelines protocol, it produces an approved drug.

rules.prover9_expression: (has_research_team(company, scientists) -> (-(has_license(company, production_facility) | has_fda_registration(company, facility)) -> follows_protocol(company, manufacturing_guidelines)))
rules.natural: If the company employs a research team of scientists, then in the absence of a production facility license or FDA registration, it adheres to manufacturing guidelines protocol.
Should the company undergo an FDA audit at its facility, it receives FDA approval for its drug.
Either the company possesses marketing rights for the drug, or it does not receive FDA approval for the drug.
If the company lacks both a production facility license and FDA registration, then it requires regulatory review for the drug.
Whenever the company lacks a production facility license or FDA registration, it utilizes approved substances as ingredients.
Should the company not have a production facility license or FDA registration, then it does not implement quality control for its process.
If using approved ingredients does not lead to producing an approved drug, then the company undergoes an FDA audit at its facility.
